abstract.text: A view that displays a list of values in a pop-up menu where the user selects a value or types in a custom value.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: A combo box combines the behavior of an
object. A combo box displays a list of values from a pop-up list, but also provides a means for users to type in custom values. For example, here’s a combo box in its initial state.
Clicking in the text portion of the control allows the user to edit the current value. When the user clicks the down arrow at the right side of the text field, the pop-up list appears.
protocol, which declares the methods that
uses to access the contents of its data source object.

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary to interact with an assistive app.
A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary for an accessibility element to act as navigable static text.
The complete list of properties and methods for accessible elements.
A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary for an accessibility element to act as static text.
A set of methods that defines a way to add animation to an existing class with a minimum of API impact.
A set of methods for getting and setting the appearance attributes of a view.
A view that displays a list of values in a pop-up menu where the user selects a value or types in a custom value.
Adds an object to the end of the receiver’s internal item list.
Adds multiple objects to the end of the receiver’s internal item list.
A Boolean value indicating whether the combo box tries to complete what the user types.
The object that provides the item data for the combo box.
Sets the receiver’s delegate.
Deselects the pop-up list item at the specified index if it’s selected.
A Boolean value indicating whether the combo box has a vertical scroller.
Searches the receiver’s internal item list for the specified object and returns the lowest matching index.
The index of the last item selected from the pop-up list.
Inserts an object at the specified location in the receiver’s internal item list.
The horizontal and vertical spacing between cells in the pop-up list.
A Boolean value indicating whether the combo box displays a border.
The height of each item in the pop-up list.
Returns the object located at the given index within the receiver’s internal item list.
Informs the receiver that the number of items in its data source has changed.
The total number of items in the pop-up list.
The maximum number of visible items to display in the pop-up list at one time.
The object corresponding to the last item selected from the pop-up list.
An array of the items from the combo box’s internal list.
Marks the receiver as needing redisplay, so that it will reload the data for visible pop-up items and draw the new values.
Removes all items from the receiver’s internal item list.
Removes the object at the specified location from the receiver’s internal item list.
Removes all occurrences of the given object from the receiver’s internal item list.
Scrolls the receiver’s pop-up list vertically so that the item at the specified index is as close to the top as possible.
Scrolls the receiver’s pop-up list vertically so that the item at the specified index is visible.
Selects the pop-up list row at the given index.
Selects the first pop-up list item that corresponds to the given object.
Posted after the pop-up list selection of the
changes.
Posted whenever the pop-up list selection of the
is changing.
A Boolean value indicating whether the combo box retrieves its items from a data source object.
Posted whenever the pop-up list of the
is about to be dismissed.
Posted whenever the pop-up list of the
is going to be displayed.
The user interface of a combo box.
A set of methods that the destination object (or recipient) of a dragged image must implement.
A control for selecting an item from a list.
Methods that responder subclasses implement to support key binding commands, such as inserting tabs and newlines, or moving the insertion point.
A protocol that describes specific kinds of input content types.
Text the user can select or edit to send an action message to a target when the user presses the Return key.
A protocol that an object adopts to create a bar object in your app.
A protocol that marks classes to restore the state of your app to continue a user activity.
A set of methods used to associate a unique identifier with objects in your user interface.
A protocol that a custom class can adopt to manage the enabled state of a UI element.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
